metadata.synopsis: A Glasgow man (Robert Carlyle) visits war-torn Nicaragua with a refugee (Oyanka Cabezas) tormented by her memories.

reviews: Oyanka Cabezas is an absolute revelation as Carla: unbelievably subdued and melancholic in Glasgow, yet she comes alive with vivacity and passion on arriving in Nicaragua.
An extraordinary illustration of the power of the cinematic art form.
A striking and memorable film about the emotional firefights that flare up when the personal and the political are linked.
It really wasn't that bad of a film, it was just too flat and preachy.
